intro: Eurystegia andromediflora, commonly known as the silverleaf eurystegia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, featuring leathery, elliptical leaves with a silvery underside. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it requires careful management to prevent invasive spread.
